intro: Ficus spiralis, commonly known as the spiral fig, is a unique species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves along its stems, which gives it an unusual and ornamental appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into edible fig fruits. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its adaptability. Its foliage provides both aesthetic value and air-purifying benefits.
